results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Medicare;Social Security (US);Retirement;Democratic Party;Republican Party;House of Representatives;Senate
results.title: Republicans, Eyeing Majority, Float Changes to Social Security and Medicare
results.abstract: Democrats have seized on Republican proposals to limit retirement benefits to galvanize voters ahead of the midterm elections.

media.caption: Senator Rick Scott, Republican of Florida, has proposed subjecting nearly all federal spending programs to a renewal vote every year, which would make Medicare and Social Security more vulnerable to budget cuts.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: Parkland Gunman Gets 34 Life Sentences
results.abstract: The gunman who killed 17 people at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School was addressed directly by the families of his victims for the first time.

media.caption: Linda Beigel Schulman displayed a composite photo of the 17 murdered students and staff as she gave her victim impact statement on Wednesday. Her son, Scott Beigel, was killed in the 2018 mass shooting.
media.copyright: Pool photo by Amy Beth Bennett

results.adx_keywords: Hurricanes and Tropical Storms;Atlantic Ocean;Bermuda
results.title: Hurricane Martin Intensifies but Poses No Threat to Land
results.abstract: The storm, which was moving over the central North Atlantic early Thursday, was expected to grow larger and stronger before weakening.

media.caption: Martin, which formed as a tropical storm on Tuesday, grew to hurricane strength on Wednesday.
media.copyright: CIRA/NOAA

results.byline: By Kim Severson and Julia Moskin
results.title: Julie Powell, Food Writer Known for ‘Julie & Julia,’ Dies at 49
results.abstract: She attempted to cook every recipe in a classic Julia Child cookbook and documented the effort in a popular blog that became a best-selling book and a hit movie.

media.caption: Julie Powell in 2009, the year Nora Ephron's movie “Julie & Julia,” based on Ms. Powell’s book, was released.
media.copyright: Kelly Campbell, via Little, Brown & Company

results.title: Police Cameras at Pelosi’s House Were Unmonitored as They Caught Break-In
results.abstract: Minutes went by before any Capitol Police officer reviewed the footage. Law enforcement leaders said they planned to beef up protections for members of Congress.

results.title: Former Heavyweight Boxer Charged With Trafficking $1 Billion of Cocaine
results.abstract: Goran Gogic helped move vast amounts of cocaine from Colombia to Europe using U.S. ports, prosecutors said. One haul was among the largest cocaine seizures in U.S. history, they said.

media.caption: Goran Gogic, a former heavyweight boxer, was charged with trafficking over 20 tons of cocaine estimated to be worth more than $1 billion, prosecutors said.

results.title: As Housing Costs Soar, Co-Living Makes a Comeback
results.abstract: The living arrangements, known as “dorms for adults,” are on the upswing after declining in the pandemic, and developers are adapting to the renewed interest.

results.title: Biden, in Midterm Campaign Pitch, Focuses on Social Security and Medicare
results.abstract: In a whirlwind tour of Florida, the president sought to paint Republicans as a threat to the two retirement programs. But his campaign swing did not go without bumps.
